definitions.definition: a place where people stay in tents or other temporary structures:
examples: We pitched/set up camp (= put up our tents) by the lakeside.

definitions.definition: an area where people are kept temporarily for a particular reason:
a place where soldiers stay when they are training or fighting a war:
to put up a tent and stay in it for a short while, for example while on holiday:
examples: We camped on one of the lower slopes of the mountain.

definitions.definition: to put a group of tents or temporary shelters in one place, or to put someone in a group of tents or temporary shelters:
examples: Troops were camped only 25 miles from the capital.

definitions.definition: (of a man) behaving and dressing in a way that some people think is typical of a gay man:
examples: What's the name of that amazingly camp actor with the high voice and a funny walk?

definitions.definition: using bright colours, loud sounds, unusual behaviour, etc. in a humorous way:
examples: Their shows are always incredibly camp and flamboyant.
